Main Content: O-1 Ready Filing Program | Immediate Agent-Based Petition | IGTA Visa Services Skip to content Contact Us Already Qualified? File Your O-1 in 30 Days for $10,000 Skip the evidence building. We handle everything: petition prep, agent representation, employer connections, and complete filing – all within 30 days. 30-day filing guarantee Work for unlimited employers Start your own business High approval rate 48-hour qualification assessment Transparent O-1 Ready Filing Investment YOUR INVESTMENT BREAKDOWN: Service Fee: $10,000 What This Covers: Complete petition preparation Agent-petitioner service (3 years) Employer network access Work itinerary & projects Attorney coordination One RFE response included USCIS Fees (Paid Separately): Regular Processing (4-6 months): $1,100 Premium Processing (15 days): $5000 TOTAL INVESTMENT: Regular: $11,100 Premium: $15,000 Payment Plans Available: Starting at $5,000 to start and balance to file Must be paid in full before filing Regular Processing - $11,000 Premium Processing - $15,000 Start a payment plan Are You Ready to File? Check Your Evidence You need at least 3 of these 8 criteria: Awards & Recognition National or international awards in your field Published Work Articles in major publications or journals Media Coverage Featured in Forbes, TechCrunch, or major outlets Judge/Expert Role Invited to judge competitions or review peers High Salary Compensation well above industry average Elite Membership Professional organizations requiring achievements Original Contributions Patents, research, or significant innovations Critical Role Essential positions at recognized companies Not Sure If You Qualify? Book consultation The Complete Ready Filing Package Agent Petitioner Service Unlike employer-tied O-1s, our agent structure gives you: Work for multiple companies Change jobs without refiling Start your own business Accept consulting work Complete career control Complete Documentation We handle all paperwork Form I-129 preparation Evidence organization Petition letter (100-250 pages) USCIS-ready formatting Your Support Team Dedicated professionals including Case Manager for updates Immigration Specialist for strategy Legal Coordinator for compliance Success Manager for timeline Direct support throughout Real Work Itinerary USCIS requires proof of work Actual client projects provided Employer introductions Contract opportunities Speaking engagements Portfolio building work Your 30-Day Journey to O-1 Filing Day 1-2: Assessment Submit evidence Get approval to proceed Sign agreement Day 3-20: Preparation Compile all evidence Draft petition letter Create work itinerary Legal review Day 21-30: Finalization Final review Sign forms Submit to USCIS Receive tracking info Day 31+: Processing Regular: 4-6 months Premium: 15 days Updates throughout Protection If Your First Filing Needs Adjustment Repackaging Service: $2,000 (Plus USCIS filing fees) What's Included: Complete denial analysis Evidence strengthening 2 months profile building support ($600 value) Rewritten petition addressing concerns Priority refiling Repackaging Service - $2,000 Frequently Asked Questions How do I know if I'm ready to file? Take our 2-minute assessment for an instant score. Generally, if you have 3+ of the 8 O-1 criteria with strong evidence, you’re ready. What's the difference between Regular and Premium processing? Regular processing costs $1,100 and takes 4-6 months. Premium costs $1,500 and guarantees a response in 15 days. The service fee ($10,000) is the same for both. Can I really work for multiple companies? Yes! With our agent-based petition, you can work for unlimited employers, switch jobs without refiling, and even start your own business. What happens if I get an RFE or denial? Your package includes one RFE response. If denied (rare at 6%), our repackaging service is available for $2,000 plus filing fees. Do I need a job offer first? No! We provide the work itinerary through our project network. You can find your own opportunities or work with our employer partners after approval. Ready to File Your O-1 in 30 Days? Stop waiting for the H-1B lottery. If you have the evidence, we’ll have you filed this month. Ready to File Your O-1? This program is designed for professionals who have strong technical skills but lack the documented evidence needed for immediate O-1 filing. You're a Perfect Fit If: Current Visa Status: F-1 student approaching graduation On OPT with 6+ months remaining H-1B holder wanting more flexibility H-1B lottery reject looking for alternatives International professional outside the US Professional Background: 2-5 years of work experience Strong technical or business skills Bachelor's or master's degree Currently employed or actively working Passionate about building reputation in your field Evidence Gap: Have 0-2 of the 8 O-1 criteria currently No major awards or recognition yet Few or no publications Limited media coverage Want to build extraordinary ability systematically Not Sure Where You Stand? Take our free assessment to see how many O-1 criteria you currently meet and which ones need development. Take the Free Assessment Choose Your Path: Pro or Elite Tier Both tiers provide evidence building support. The Elite tier adds complete O-1 filing at the end of the program. $15,000/year What’s Included vs. Additional: PRO Tier Includes: Publications, portfolio, projects, community, coaching, media pitching PRO Tier Additional Costs: O-1 filing (arrange separately), attorney fees, USCIS fees Elite Tier Includes: Everything in Pro PLUS complete O-1 filing, legal fees, agent-petitioner service, USCIS fees Elite Tier Additional Costs: None – everything included to approval ELITE TIER PRICING: Option 1: Monthly $2,000/month 6-8 month program duration Includes complete O-1 filing All legal fees covered Best for: Budget flexibility ELITE Tier - $2,000/month Option 2: Regular Processing Track $10,000 total (6 months) Approximately $1,667/month O-1 filed at month 6 4-6 months USCIS processing Best for: Planned timeline ELITE Regular - $10,000 total Option 3: Premium Processing Track $15,000 total (8 months) Approximately $1,875/month O-1 filed at month 8 15-day USCIS processing Best for: Time-sensitive situations ELITE Premium - $15,000 total What’s Included vs. Additional: PRO Tier Includes: Publications, portfolio, projects, community, coaching, media pitching PRO Tier Additional Costs: O-1 filing (arrange separately), attorney fees, USCIS fees Elite Tier Includes: Everything in Pro PLUS complete O-1 filing, legal fees, agent-petitioner service, USCIS fees Elite Tier Additional Costs: None – everything included to approval What We Expect From You Time Commitment: Weekly Requirements: 10-12 hours on project work 2-3 hours for workshops and community 1 hour for coaching calls and planning Total: 13-16 hours per week Can You Do This While Working Full-Time? Yes. Most participants maintain full-time employment or F-1 studies while in the program. Active Participation: You Must: Attend coaching calls regularly Complete project assignments on time Review and approve articles promptly Respond to media interview requests Participate in community actively Follow the evidence building roadmap We Cannot Help If: You're not responsive to communication You skip project work consistently You don't review articles for approval You avoid media opportunities You're not invested in your success Realistic Expectations: This Program Cannot: Guarantee O-1 approval (no one can legally guarantee USCIS approval) Build evidence overnight (takes 6-8 months minimum) Do the work for you (you must participate actively) Replace your professional development (this enhances it) This Program DOES: Provide systematic evidence building framework Give you real opportunities for recognition Connect you with high-value projects Position you for O-1 qualification Support you throughout the journey From Application to Enrollment in One Week Step 1: Free Assessment Take the 2-minute evaluation: Submit your background and current evidence. Get instant score showing how many of 8 O-1 criteria you currently meet. Result: Know exactly where you stand Step 2: Strategy Call (If Qualified) 15-30 minute phone consultation: Review your assessment results Discuss which tier fits your situation Map out your evidence building timeline Answer all your questions Determine program fit Result: Clear understanding of your path forward Step 3: Enrollment If we’re a mutual fit: Choose your tier and payment option Sign enrollment agreement Submit payment Receive welcome packet Result: Official program member Step 4: Onboarding (Week 1) Your first week: Meet your success manager (Elite tier) Complete detailed intake questionnaire Schedule your first coaching call Join the private community Receive first project assignment Submit topics for first articles Result: Ready to start building evidence Frequently Asked Questions How is this different from the Ready Filing program? Ready Filing is for people who already have 3-4 of the 8 O-1 criteria documented. Profile Building is for people who need to CREATE that evidence over 6-8 months. If you’re not sure which you need, take our assessment. Can I do this while on F-1 or OPT? Yes. The program is designed to work within F-1 and OPT restrictions. Project work is structured as educational/training rather than unauthorized employment. We have successfully worked with hundreds of F-1/OPT participants. What if I'm on H-1B? Perfect timing. Build your O-1 evidence while you have valid status, then transition to O-1 for more flexibility. You can participate in the program while maintaining H-1B employment. Do I need to quit my job? No. The program requires 13-16 hours per week, which most people fit around full-time work. Evening and weekend flexibility is available. What happens if I need to pause the program? You can pause for up to 60 days once during your enrollment for emergencies or major life events. Notify us 2 weeks in advance. Your timeline extends by the pause duration. Can I switch from Pro to Elite tier? Yes. You can upgrade from Pro to Elite at any time. The cost difference is credited toward your Elite tier fees. What if I don't qualify for O-1 after the program? If you complete the full Elite program and we file but you’re denied, we’ll work with you on repackaging and refiling at discounted rates. Our vetting process ensures we only file strong cases, but if something unexpected happens, we don’t abandon you. Are the articles really ghostwritten? Yes. Professional writers research and draft articles based on your input and expertise. You review, provide feedback, and approve before publication. They’re published under your name with you as the author. What industries do you work with? Primarily technology, AI/ML, software engineering, data science, and tech-adjacent fields. We also work with business professionals, researchers, and some creative technologists. Can international people outside the US join? Yes. The program is 100% remote. We work with people in India, China, Taiwan, Eastern Europe, Latin America, and everywhere else. Do you guarantee O-1 approval? No service can legally guarantee USCIS approval – that decision is solely USCIS’s. We can guarantee we’ll file your petition if you complete the Elite program, and we have a 94% approval rate, but the final decision is always USCIS’s. What happens to my articles and portfolio if I leave the program? Everything created during your time in the program remains yours permanently. Articles stay published under your name. Your portfolio site remains active. All evidence is yours to keep. How many people are in each cohort? We accept approximately 50 new members per month to maintain quality and individual attention. The community has 500+ total members at various stages. Start Building Your O-1 Profile Today The H-1B lottery rejected 670,000 qualified professionals in 2024. Don’t let random chance control your career. Build O-1 qualification through merit instead. Main Content: Research Package - IGTA Automation Studios Skip to content Contact Us Get Full Research Package AI-Powered O-1 Visa Evidence Research for Developers Claude AI analyzes your technical achievements against USCIS extraordinary ability standards to generate comprehensive petition research documentation. Access Research Package Powered by Claude Sonnet 4 17+ Immigration Reference Sources Because Your O-1 Petition Deserves the Same Rigor as Your Code You wouldn’t ship production code without comprehensive testing. Why submit an O-1 petition without thorough research? The Full Research Package is a specialized knowledge base system built specifically for AI/ML developers, software engineers, and tech professionals seeking U.S. work authorization through the O-1 visa. Think of it as your petition’s CI/CD pipeline—automated, thorough, and designed to catch edge cases before USCIS does. Built on Advanced AI Infrastructure Code-style presentation System Architecture Knowledge Base: 17+ Immigration Reference Sources AI Engine: Claude Sonnet 4 with specialized prompting Token Management: Multi-tiered allocation (8K-50K) Processing: Character-based preprocessing + semantic extraction Output: Customized research documentation Optimization: Context-aware truncation algorithms This system processes USCIS policy memoranda, AAO decisions, regulatory code (8 CFR § 214.2(o)), precedent cases, and industry-specific standards to generate research tailored to your technical profile. It’s not a template. It’s a dynamic knowledge extraction system that understands both immigration law AND technical career trajectories. Input Your Technical Profile, Get Comprehensive Research 1. Technical Contributions Open source projects and adoption metrics Patents and published research Novel algorithms or system architectures Significant technical innovations 2. Industry Recognition Conference presentations and keynotes Technical publications and citations GitHub stars, npm downloads, PyPI stats Awards and recognitions (e.g., hackathons, grants) 3. Critical Capacity Evidence Leadership roles at top tech companies Essential contributions to major projects High compensation relative to field Specialized expertise others lack 4. Scholarly Articles Research papers and citations Technical blog posts with wide readership Documentation or books published Contributions to technical standards 5. Judging & Peer Review Code review for major projects Conference paper reviews Technical evaluation panels Open source project maintainer role 6. Membership Evidence Invitation-only tech communities Technical advisory boards Standards organizations (W3C, IEEE, etc.) Exclusive developer programs (e.g., GitHub Stars) Your Research Package Includes Regulatory Analysis O-1A extraordinary ability criteria for your specialization USCIS standards for evaluating technical contributions Compliance requirements for current regulations Evidence Mapping Your technical achievements → O-1A evidentiary criteria Quantitative metrics USCIS values in tech fields Gap analysis: evidence you should develop Advisory Letter Guidance What technical experts should emphasize Industry context for your contributions Specific accomplishments to highlight Industry Standards How USCIS evaluates "extraordinary" in AI/ML/SWE Precedent cases for similar technical profiles Salary and compensation benchmarks Documentation Strategy Organizing GitHub, papers, patents for petition Presenting open source impact effectively Timeline and achievement narrative structure Optimized for Technical Professionals Understands Your Work The system recognizes that GitHub contributions, npm package downloads, and Stack Overflow reputation are valid evidence of extraordinary ability—and knows how to present them to USCIS. The platform includes parental controls, automatic content moderation, and COPPA compliance built-in. Monetization through $14.99/month subscriptions plus revenue sharing on sponsored content. Sales & Proposals Generate proposals, qualify leads, draft emails, research prospects Data Analysis Pull reports, analyze trends, create visualizations, summarize metrics Content Creation Write blogs, social posts, emails, scripts—all in your brand voice Training & Onboarding Answer employee questions, provide procedures, guide workflows Research Assistant Gather competitive intel, summarize reports, find insights Customer Support Answer FAQs, troubleshoot issues, provide product guidance Documentation Generate SOPs, update wikis, create templates Process Automation Connect tools, trigger workflows, update systems FAQ Common Questions About Custom GPTs What's the difference between ChatGPT and a custom GPT? Standard ChatGPT is a general-purpose chatbot. A custom GPT is trained on YOUR specific knowledge, follows YOUR processes, and can connect to YOUR tools via custom actions. It’s like having an employee who knows your business inside and out. Do I need a ChatGPT Plus subscription? Yes, to create and use custom GPTs, you need ChatGPT Plus ($20/month per user) or ChatGPT Team/Enterprise. I’ll help you understand which plan fits your needs during our session. Can I share my custom GPT with my team? Absolutely! With ChatGPT Team or Enterprise, you can share GPTs across your organization. With Plus, you can share via link. I’ll show you the best approach for your situation. How much knowledge can I upload? You can upload multiple files up to 2GB total per GPT. For most businesses, that’s plenty for docs, templates, procedures, and guidelines. I’ll help you optimize what to include. What if I want to update my GPT later? You can make simple updates yourself using my documentation. For significant changes or new features, book another block. Many clients do periodic updates every few months. Can you integrate with any tool or API? If it has an API, I can connect it. Common integrations: CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce), project tools (Asana, ClickUp), Google Sheets, databases, and more. If you’re unsure, ask during booking. What if I prefer to work independently during the build? No problem! Just select ‘Independent Work’ when you book. Most efficient option. Most projects, balanced approach, time-conscious founders Not sure? We'll decide together during the booking process. B2B Tools CRM, project management, team collaboration, sales tools Analytics Platforms Business intelligence, dashboards, reporting, data viz Content Tools AI writing, social media management, content calendars E-commerce Storefronts, inventory management, order processing Ed-Tech Learning platforms, course management, student portals Community Platforms Forums, social networks, membership sites Healthcare Patient portals, appointment booking, health tracking AI-Powered Tools Chatbots, automation, AI integrations, ML demos FAQ Common Questions About SaaS Prototypes What's the difference between a prototype and MVP? A prototype proves your concept works—it demonstrates core functionality but may have rough edges. An MVP is a more polished version ready for real users. Most founders start with a prototype (what I build), validate, then invest in a full MVP. Will this be production-ready? Not quite. It’s functional and looks good, but it’s built for speed, not scale. Think of it as a proof-of-concept that proves your idea works. You’ll need additional development to make it production-ready (security hardening, optimization, testing). Can I use this with real customers? For demos and early beta testing, yes. For production use with paying customers, you’ll need additional work. I’ll flag what needs to be addressed before going live. What if my idea is complex and needs more than 3 hours? Main Content: Data Science O-1 Visa Success Story | From H-1B Lottery to Career Freedom | IGTA Skip to content Contact Us From H-1B Rejection to Multiple Fortune 500 Clients: Data Scientist's O-1 Journey How a data professional partnered with Bamsi Services & Procurement Corp. to build O-1 evidence through research awards and publications - now consulting for top companies with zero restrictions The Problem: Talent Trapped by a Lottery System Master's degree in hand Technical expertise in data science H-1B lottery odds: 14% This data scientist had the skills but not the luck. What They Wanted: Consult for multiple Fortune 500 companies Work on diverse projects across industries Build reputation through published research No arbitrary salary minimums Career control, not visa control What Was Blocking Them: The H-1B lottery wasn’t about merit. One employer. One project. One chance per year. 85% rejection rate. “I’m not letting random chance determine my career path.” Building the O-1 Case: 18 Months to Approval The Evidence Strategy Instead of gambling on H-1B, this professional systematically built extraordinary ability evidence: Won Prestigious National Award Federal Aviation Administration Graduate Research Award Competed against PhD students from MIT, Stanford, Johns Hopkins Only master's student selected that year $50,000+ research grant Published in Top-Tier Journals 4 peer-reviewed publications Strategic Finance Magazine (featured on cover) Management Accounting Quarterly (won Lybrand Award) Analytics Magazine (INFORMS publication) Transportation Research Record (leading transport journal) Media Recognition Featured in AI Time Journal podcast Inspirationfeed profile (6.6M monthly readers) Tech industry publications American Association for the Advancement of Science platform Became the Judge Invited to judge FAA research proposals Director of IMA Research Foundation Reviews grant applications from academics at top universities Expert panel member for national aviation research program Timeline from Start to O-1 Approval: 18 months Working Across Multiple Industries with Agent-Based Structure Primary Agent-Petitioner Bamsi Services & Procurement Corp. US-based talent management and consulting firm Specializes in business, science, and technology professionals Provides access to Fortune 500 client network Agent-petitioner structure enabling multiple employer flexibility Based in North Carolina Client Companies (Multiple Simultaneous Engagements) Fortune 500 Corporations Data analytics consulting Machine learning implementation Credit risk modeling Business intelligence strategy Financial Institutions Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) modeling Vector Autoregression analysis Financial forecasting systems Regulatory compliance analytics Aviation Industry Organizations Airport bond valuation analysis Transportation research collaboration Federal Aviation Administration projects Airport Cooperative Research Program (ACRP) Accounting & Consulting Firms AI and NLP in accounting Management accounting research Business analytics implementation Industry training and workshops Advisory Roles Institute of Management Accountants (IMA) Research Foundation Director Reviews grant proposals 140,000+ members in 150 countries Airport Cooperative Research Program (ACRP) Expert panel member Federal Aviation Administration funded program Evaluates research proposals The Agent-Based Advantage: No single employer restrictions. Complete flexibility to accept projects from any client. Work with whoever offers the best opportunities. Life After O-1: Complete Career Freedom What Changed: Multiple Employers Simultaneously Currently consulting for 5+ companies across different industries Higher Income Potential Consulting rates far exceed single-employer salary caps No $100K minimum requirement to navigate Complete Project Flexibility Accept or decline projects based on interest and opportunity No visa filing needed to switch clients Research Freedom Continue publishing in peer-reviewed journals Judge others' research proposals Build academic reputation alongside industry work No Lottery Anxiety 3-year O-1 visa with unlimited renewals Path to EB-1A Green Card using same evidence Career planning certainty “Working with Bamsi Services as my agent-petitioner changed everything. I’m not tied to one employer or one project. I consult for Fortune 500 companies, publish research, serve on expert panels, and choose the work that excites me. The O-1 gave me what H-1B never could – actual career freedom.” By The Numbers: What 18 Months of Strategic Building Achieved Achievement Summary: 4 Publications in peer-reviewed journals 2 Major Awards (FAA Grant, Lybrand Award) 5+ Media Features in industry publications 5+ Companies served simultaneously 2 Director-Level Roles (IMA, ACRP) 18 Months from start to O-1 approval 0 RFEs - approved on first submission Companies Worked With: Bamsi Services & Procurement Corp. (agent-petitioner) Fortune 500 corporations (consulting) Major financial institutions (ML/analytics) Aviation industry firms (research & analysis) Top accounting firms (AI implementation) What This Success Story Teaches You Don't Need: A PhD from an Ivy League school 10+ years of experience To win the H-1B lottery To sacrifice career flexibility You DO Need: Strategic evidence building (awards, publications, media) The right visa structure (agent-based, not employer-tied) 18-24 months to build your case A partner like Bamsi Services or similar agent-petitioner Merit beats luck. Every single time. The H-1B lottery failed 670,000 people in 2024. This professional didn’t wait around to be one of them. Ready to Build Your Own O-1 Success Story? Whether you’re in data science, AI, software engineering, or another tech field, the O-1 pathway offers what H-1B cannot: career freedom based on merit, not luck. Main Content: Game Developer O-1B Success | 64M Players | Treetop Games & Uplift Games | IGTA Skip to content Contact Us 64 Million Players Later: Game Developer Secures O-1B with Treetop Games LLC How the Creative Director of award-winning game Adopt Me partnered with Treetop Games and Uplift Games for O-1B visa - now working across multiple studios with complete creative freedom The Challenge: UK Developer Wanting US Opportunities Award-winning game with millions of players Warner Brothers partnership Operating companies in UK Stuck outside US market What They Needed: Work with US gaming studios (Treetop Games, Uplift Games) Maintain ownership of UK company (Lionfield Investments) Accept branded partnerships (Warner Brothers, major brands) Build multiple games simultaneously Creative freedom across projects What H-1B Would Have Meant: One employer. One project. No company ownership. No side partnerships. Career death for a creative professional. “I need a visa that works for creatives, not corporate employees.” Adopt Me: Building Undeniable Extraordinary Achievement The Numbers That Proved Everything 64 million monthly active players 18 billion total visits 1.78 million concurrent players - broke Roblox world record No. 1 game on entire Roblox platform (PC, mobile, Xbox) $50 million+ revenue generated The Awards Roblox Bloxy Awards (Multiple Years): Best Game Update of the Year Most Concurrents (highest simultaneous players) Most Visits (total player visits) Highest Total Playtime Studio of the Year Industry Recognition: Selected for Roblox Accelerator Program (only 30 developers chosen annually from thousands) The Partnership That Changed Everything Warner Brothers Entertainment Collaboration (2020) Major Hollywood studio commissioned team to promote SCOOB film Creative Director role: art and narrative direction Integrated Scooby Doo characters into Adopt Me Generated international press coverage Why This Mattered for O-1B: When Warner Brothers seeks you out by name? That’s extraordinary achievement. The Media Coverage Featured in major publications: Forbes Magazine The Washington Post BBC CNBC The Economist PC Gamer Entertainment Focus Vice Timeline from Start to O-1 Approval: 18 months Multi-Studio Structure: Agent-Based O-1B Freedom Primary Agent-Petitioner Treetop Games LLC Location: 823 Congress Avenue, Austin, Texas 78701 Founded: 2018 CEO: Floyd Horng Role: Leading game design and development firm Team: 20+ engineers, artists, and support staff Key Partnership: Co-developed Adopt Me O-1B Function: Agent-petitioner enabling multi-studio work Partner Studios Uplift Games Role: Collaborative game development partner Projects: Multiple ongoing game initiatives Collaboration: Joint development on new gaming titles Lionfield Investments Ltd Location: London, United Kingdom Role: Personal company (founder & Creative Director) Key Product: Adopt Me Revenue: $50+ million to date Status: Maintained ownership and operations Major Brand Partnerships Warner Brothers Entertainment SCOOB film promotion partnership (2020) Creative and narrative direction for branded content Major Hollywood studio collaboration Ongoing partnership discussions Roblox Corporation Platform partnership with 164 million monthly users Featured as flagship success story Regular collaboration with Roblox leadership Direct access to VP of Brand Partnerships Why Agent-Based O-1B Was Critical Traditional Employer-Sponsored Visa Would Have Meant: Pick ONE company (Treetop OR Uplift OR Lionfield) No Warner Brothers partnership No company ownership No side projects No creative flexibility Agent-Based O-1B With Treetop Games Meant: Work with Treetop Games in Austin Collaborate with Uplift Games Own and operate Lionfield Investments Accept Warner Brothers deals Build new games freely Why O-1B (Arts) - Not O-1A (Tech) Understanding the Difference: O-1A = Sciences, Business, Technology For engineers, programmers, data scientists, technical roles O-1B = Arts, Motion Pictures, Television For creative directors, game designers, artists, narrative directors Why This Case Was O-1B: Why This Case Was O-1B: Creative Director - not a programmer or engineer Art and Narrative - primary focus on creative vision Game Design - artistic and storytelling role Industry Awards - creative excellence recognition (Bloxy Awards) Entertainment Overlap - Warner Brothers film partnership The Evidence Package: Lead Role in Distinguished Production Creative Director of No. 1 Roblox game with 64M players Commercial Success $50M+ revenue, 18B visits, proven market acclaim Industry Awards 5 major Roblox Bloxy Awards over multiple years Major Media Coverage Forbes, Washington Post, BBC, CNBC, The Economist Critical Partnerships Warner Brothers, Roblox Accelerator Program selection Innovation in Field Pioneered new game mechanics on Roblox platform Timeline: 3 years building the game → O-1B approved Life After O-1B: Multiple Studios, Complete Creative Freedom What The Visa Enables: Work with Treetop Games LLC (Austin) Lead Creative Director for Adopt Me and new projects Partner with Uplift Games Collaborative development on multiple gaming titles Own Lionfield Investments Ltd (UK) Maintain company ownership and creative control Accept Major Brand Deals Warner Brothers-style partnerships, promotional collaborations Build New Games Launch new IPs, start additional studios, pursue creative visions Consult for Other Developers Advise other gaming studios, judge competitions, speak at conferences “Treetop Games as my agent-petitioner was the perfect structure. I’m working on Adopt Me in Austin, partnering with Uplift Games on new projects, running my UK company Lionfield Investments, and taking meetings with Warner Brothers – all under one O-1B visa. No other visa structure gives creatives this kind of freedom.” By The Numbers: Extraordinary Achievement Portfolio Game Performance: 64 million monthly players (peak) 18 billion+ total visits 1.78 million concurrent players (world record) No. 1 game on entire Roblox platform Industry Recognition: 5 Roblox Bloxy Awards Selected: Roblox Accelerator (30 of thousands) 8+ major media features Warner Brothers partnership Social Media Impact: 1.6M Instagram followers 1.75M YouTube subscribers 3.3M TikTok followers 879K Twitter followers 435K+ Discord members Companies: Treetop Games LLC (Austin, TX) - agent-petitioner Uplift Games - partner studio Lionfield Investments Ltd (UK) - founder Warner Brothers - brand partner Financial Success: $50 million+ revenue generated Multi-million dollar enterprise valuation One of highest-grossing Roblox games What This Success Story Teaches Creative Professionals For Game Developers and Creatives: Consider O-1B If You: Are a Creative Director, not just a programmer Have measurable creative impact (players, views, revenue) Won industry awards for creative work Featured in major media for creative achievements Need to work across multiple projects/studios What Made This Work: Measurable Success 64M players and $50M revenue = undeniable proof Industry Awards Roblox Bloxy Awards = peer recognition from gaming community Major Partnerships Warner Brothers = validation from Hollywood establishment Media Coverage Forbes, BBC, Washington Post = national recognition beyond gaming Agent-Based Structure Treetop Games as agent = flexibility for creative professionals The Truth: Creative professionals need creative visa structures. One employer kills creativity. “Don’t try to fit into an H-1B box. If you’re a creative – game designer, artist, creative director – O-1B with an agent-based structure is your path to freedom.” Ready to Build Your O-1B Case? Whether you’re a game developer, digital artist, creative director, or entertainment professional, the O-1B pathway offers career flexibility that no other visa can match. Main Content: Case Studies - IGTA Automation Studios Skip to content Contact Us Case Studies O-1A Visa Bridge Strategy for Green Card Backlogs December 12, 2025 The O-1A Visa as a Bridge Strategy for Professionals Waiting on Green Card Priority Dates The employment-based green card backlog has created a frustrating paradox: USCIS recognizes a professional’s extraordinary ability or national interest The employment-based green card backlog has created a frustrating paradox: USCIS recognizes a professional’s extraordinary ability or national interest contribution, approves their immigrant petition, and then tells them to wait years—sometimes decades—before they can actually receive the green card. According to data tracked through the Department of State’s monthly Visa Bulletin (https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/legal/visa-law0/visa-bulletin.html), Indian nationals in the EB-2 category currently face priority date backlogs exceeding 12 years, while Chinese nationals face waits of 4+ years. Even “rest of world” applicants increasingly see multi-year delays. For professionals caught Read More O-1 to EB-1A Green Card Assessment December 12, 2025 Assessing EB-1A Green Card Readiness for Professionals with Existing O-1 Approval The O-1A nonimmigrant visa and the EB-1A immigrant visa (extraordinary ability green card) share a fundamental requirement: demonstrating that the beneficiary possesses extraordinary ability in their field. For professionals who already hold O-1 approval, a critical question emerges: Does my existing evidence already support an EB-1A petition, or do I need additional profile building? The answer determines whether you proceed directly to green card filing or invest months and thousands of dollars in evidence development programs. Understanding the Relationship Between O-1A and EB-1A Both visa categories require demonstrating extraordinary ability, but they serve different purposes and have somewhat different standards. O-1A (Nonimmigrant): Temporary work authorization Requires showing you are Read More O-1A Visa Eligibility Evaluation December 12, 2025 Evaluating O-1A Visa Eligibility: Understanding Extraordinary Ability Requirements The O-1A visa attracts significant interest from professionals seeking alternatives to the H-1B lottery system. With H-1B selection rates hovering around 25-29% in recent years (based on USCIS FY 2025 data showing 114,017 beneficiaries selected from approximately 442,000 unique registrations), many qualified professionals explore whether they might qualify for the O-1A “extraordinary ability” classification instead. The central question for these professionals: Do my achievements rise to the level USCIS considers “extraordinary”? This guide walks through the evaluation process, the actual USCIS standards, and how to realistically assess O-1A eligibility. The AI researcher had three job offers: Senior ML engineer at Google ($450K total comp) Tech lead at a promising startup (lower salary, significant equity) Consulting engagement with two Fortune 500 companies ($300/hour) Under H-1B rules, she’d have to choose one. Switching later would mean filing a new petition, waiting months, and risking denial. But Sarah wasn’t on H-1B. She had an agent-based O-1 visa. So she said yes to all four opportunities. (Not really.) The truth is, “extraordinary ability” isn’t about being the #1 person in the world. What They Wanted: Consult for multiple Fortune 500 companies Work on diverse projects across industries Build reputation through published research No arbitrary salary minimums Career control, not visa control What Was Blocking Them: The H-1B lottery wasn’t about merit. One employer. One project. One chance per year. 85% rejection rate. “I’m not letting random chance determine my career path.” Building the O-1 Case: 18 Months to Approval The Evidence Strategy Instead of gambling on H-1B, this professional systematically built extraordinary ability evidence: Won Prestigious National Award Federal Aviation Administration Graduate Research Award Competed against PhD students from MIT, Stanford, Johns Hopkins Only master's student selected that year $50,000+ research grant Published in Top-Tier Journals 4 peer-reviewed publications Strategic Finance Magazine (featured on cover) Management Accounting Quarterly (won Lybrand Award) Analytics Magazine (INFORMS publication) Transportation Research Record (leading transport journal) Media Recognition Featured in AI Time Journal podcast Inspirationfeed profile (6.6M monthly readers) Tech industry publications American Association for the Advancement of Science platform Became the Judge Invited to judge FAA research proposals Director of IMA Research Foundation Reviews grant applications from academics at top universities Expert panel member for national aviation research program Timeline from Start to O-1 Approval: 18 months Working Across Multiple Industries with Agent-Based Structure Primary Agent-Petitioner Bamsi Services & Procurement Corp. US-based talent management and consulting firm Specializes in business, science, and technology professionals Provides access to Fortune 500 client network Agent-petitioner structure enabling multiple employer flexibility Based in North Carolina Client Companies (Multiple Simultaneous Engagements) Fortune 500 Corporations Data analytics consulting Machine learning implementation Credit risk modeling Business intelligence strategy Financial Institutions Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL) modeling Vector Autoregression analysis Financial forecasting systems Regulatory compliance analytics Aviation Industry Organizations Airport bond valuation analysis Transportation research collaboration Federal Aviation Administration projects Airport Cooperative Research Program (ACRP) Accounting & Consulting Firms AI and NLP in accounting Management accounting research Business analytics implementation Industry training and workshops Advisory Roles Institute of Management Accountants (IMA) Research Foundation Director Reviews grant proposals 140,000+ members in 150 countries Airport Cooperative Research Program (ACRP) Expert panel member Federal Aviation Administration funded program Evaluates research proposals The Agent-Based Advantage: No single employer restrictions. Complete flexibility to accept projects from any client. Work with whoever offers the best opportunities. Life After O-1: Complete Career Freedom What Changed: Multiple Employers Simultaneously Currently consulting for 5+ companies across different industries Higher Income Potential Consulting rates far exceed single-employer salary caps No $100K minimum requirement to navigate Complete Project Flexibility Accept or decline projects based on interest and opportunity No visa filing needed to switch clients Research Freedom Continue publishing in peer-reviewed journals Judge others' research proposals Build academic reputation alongside industry work No Lottery Anxiety 3-year O-1 visa with unlimited renewals Path to EB-1A Green Card using same evidence Career planning certainty “Working with Bamsi Services as my agent-petitioner changed everything. I’m not tied to one employer or one project. I consult for Fortune 500 companies, publish research, serve on expert panels, and choose the work that excites me. The O-1 gave me what H-1B never could – actual career freedom.” By The Numbers: What 18 Months of Strategic Building Achieved Achievement Summary: 4 Publications in peer-reviewed journals 2 Major Awards (FAA Grant, Lybrand Award) 5+ Media Features in industry publications 5+ Companies served simultaneously 2 Director-Level Roles (IMA, ACRP) 18 Months from start to O-1 approval 0 RFEs - approved on first submission Companies Worked With: Bamsi Services & Procurement Corp. (agent-petitioner) Fortune 500 corporations (consulting) Major financial institutions (ML/analytics) Aviation industry firms (research & analysis) Top accounting firms (AI implementation) What This Success Story Teaches You Don't Need: A PhD from an Ivy League school 10+ years of experience To win the H-1B lottery To sacrifice career flexibility You DO Need: Strategic evidence building (awards, publications, media) The right visa structure (agent-based, not employer-tied) 18-24 months to build your case A partner like Bamsi Services or similar agent-petitioner Merit beats luck. Every single time. The H-1B lottery failed 670,000 people in 2024. This professional didn’t wait around to be one of them. Ready to Build Your Own O-1 Success Story? Main Content: O-1 Profile Building Program | Build Extraordinary Ability Evidence | IGTA Accelerator Skip to content Contact Us Build Your O-1 Visa Profile: From Unqualified to Filing-Ready in 6-8 Months Strategic evidence creation program for F-1 students, OPT holders, and H-1B professionals who need to build extraordinary ability documentation before filing Not Sure Where You Stand? 18-24 months typical timeline to O-1 approval Build 5-6 of 8 USCIS criteria systematically Publications, awards, and media coverage included Real project work with Fortune 500 clients Is the O-1 Profile Building Program Right for You? This program is designed for professionals who have strong technical skills but lack the documented evidence needed for immediate O-1 filing. You're a Perfect Fit If: Current Visa Status: F-1 student approaching graduation On OPT with 6+ months remaining H-1B holder wanting more flexibility H-1B lottery reject looking for alternatives International professional outside the US Professional Background: 2-5 years of work experience Strong technical or business skills Bachelor's or master's degree Currently employed or actively working Passionate about building reputation in your field Evidence Gap: Have 0-2 of the 8 O-1 criteria currently No major awards or recognition yet Few or no publications Limited media coverage Want to build extraordinary ability systematically Not Sure Where You Stand? Take our free assessment to see how many O-1 criteria you currently meet and which ones need development. Take the Free Assessment Choose Your Path: Pro or Elite Tier Both tiers provide evidence building support. The Elite tier adds complete O-1 filing at the end of the program. TIER 1: PRO - Build Your O-1 Profile Best For: Professionals who want flexibility on when to file Pricing: Monthly: $1,500/month (3-month minimum commitment) Quarterly: $5,000 for 3 months (save $500) Annual: $15,000 for 12 months (save $3,000) What's Included: Publications & Thought Leadership 3 ghostwritten technical articles per month Published in your name in industry outlets Topics aligned with your expertise SEO optimization for discoverability Portfolio of 18-36 articles over 6-12 months Professional Portfolio Development Custom portfolio website built and hosted Showcases your projects and publications LinkedIn profile optimization GitHub profile enhancement (for developers) Personal brand development Real Project Work 10-12 hours per week on actual client projects Work with Fortune 500 companies and startups Celebrity and high-profile collaborations when available Documented achievements for O-1 evidence Paid opportunities when applicable Community & Learning Private member community (500+ professionals) Bi-weekly live workshops with industry experts Peer accountability groups Alumni network access Weekly office hours with program staff Strategic Guidance Bi-weekly coaching calls Personalized evidence building roadmap O-1 criteria tracking and assessment Filing readiness evaluation Career strategy consultation Timeline Minimum 3 months to see results 6-9 months to build strong evidence File independently when ready What's NOT Included: O-1 petition filing and legal services (you arrange separately) Attorney fees (you pay directly) USCIS filing fees TIER 2: ELITE - Complete O-1 Journey Best For: Professionals who want comprehensive support and guaranteed filing Pricing: Monthly: $2,000/month Regular Processing Track: $10,000 for 6 months total Premium Processing Track: $15,000 for 8 months total Everything in PRO Tier PLUS: Guaranteed O-1 Filing Complete petition preparation included Agent-petitioner service (IGTA as your petitioner) All attorney coordination and legal fees covered Choice of processing speed: Month 6: Regular processing (4–6 months USCIS decision) Month 8: Premium processing (15-day USCIS decision) Work itinerary creation Employer network access Enhanced Profile Building Wikipedia page creation (if you qualify) Major media PR campaign (pitch to Forbes, TechCrunch, etc.) Conference speaking slot arrangements Podcast guest appearance coordination 6+ high-authority thought leadership pieces Industry award nominations White Glove Service Dedicated success manager assigned Weekly one-on-one strategy sessions Priority access to high-profile projects Interview preparation and coaching Comprehensive visa application strategy Document review and optimization Career Acceleration Direct introductions to hiring companies Salary negotiation coaching Employment contract review support Multiple employer coordination (agent-based structure) Entrepreneurship guidance Job search assistance if needed Refile Protection If denied: repackaging and refiling for $1,500 + fees Continue program support until approval RFE response handling included Timeline 6 months for regular processing track 8 months for premium processing track O-1 filing at program completion Approval 4-6 months (regular) or 15 days (premium) after filing What IS Included: Everything needed from start to O-1 approval, including all legal and filing fees The Systematic Approach to Extraordinary Ability The 8 O-1 Criteria: USCIS requires proof of 3 out of 8 criteria. Our program helps you build 5-6 to ensure strong applications. 1. Awards & Recognition How We Help: Identify relevant competitions and hackathons Prepare competition submissions Nominate you for industry awards Document all recognition systematically Timeline: 3-6 months to first award 2. Published Articles How We Help: Ghostwrite 3 technical articles monthly Publish in industry journals and outlets Topics showcase your expertise Build library of 18-36 publications Timeline: Immediate (articles start month 1) 3. Media Coverage How We Help: Pitch your story to relevant media outlets Coordinate interviews and features Secure coverage in tech publications Target both digital and traditional media Timeline: 2-4 months to first feature 4. Membership in Elite Organizations How We Help: Identify prestigious organizations in your field Prepare membership applications Recommend you for invitation-only groups Document membership credentials Timeline: 2-6 months depending on organization 5. Judge or Expert Role How We Help: Connect you with opportunities to judge hackathons Arrange expert panel participation Review opportunities for grant proposals Evaluate others' technical work Timeline: 4-8 months (requires established reputation first) 6. Original Contributions How We Help: Assign you to innovative project work Support open-source contributions Help file patents if applicable Document unique technical solutions Timeline: Ongoing throughout program 7. Critical Role How We Help: Place you on high-visibility projects Document your essential contributions Secure recommendation letters from project leads Build portfolio of critical work Timeline: Ongoing throughout program 8. High Salary How We Help: Career coaching for salary negotiation Connect with high-paying opportunities Document compensation above industry average Leverage other evidence to command higher rates incorporated Final approval from you Ongoing: 3 new articles every month Published under your name Topics rotate through your expertise areas Mix of technical depth and industry trends SEO optimized and edited Optimized for reader engagement Backed by data and examples Professional and authoritative in tone Your Portfolio After 6 Months: 18 published articles demonstrating expertise across Join 500+ Professionals Building Their O-1 Profiles What You Get Access To: Private Member Community Online community platform (Skool) with: Daily discussions and questions Peer support and accountability Success story sharing Resource library Direct access to program staff Bi-Weekly Live Workshops Expert-led sessions on: Technical skill development Career advancement strategies O-1 visa preparation insights Industry trends and opportunities Portfolio building best practices Peer Accountability Groups Small cohorts of 5-8 members: Weekly check-ins Goal setting and tracking Mutual support and encouragement Collaboration opportunities Alumni Network Connect with 500+ program graduates: Job referrals and opportunities Mentorship from those who've succeeded Business partnership possibilities Continued learning and growth Weekly Office Hours Direct access to program staff: Answer questions about your progress Get feedback on your work Discuss strategy and adjustments Troubleshoot challenges Investment in Your Career Freedom PRO TIER PRICING: Option 1: Monthly $1,500/month 3-month minimum commitment Cancel anytime after minimum Most flexible option Best for: Testing the program PRO Tier - $1,500/month Option 2: Quarterly $5,000 for 3 months Save $500 vs. monthly Single upfront payment Best for: Committed professionals PRO Tier - $5,000 for 3 months Option 3: Annual $15,000 for 12 months Save $3,000 vs. monthly Maximum savings Best for: Long-term evidence building PRO Tier - $15,000/year What’s Included vs. Additional: PRO Tier Includes: Publications, portfolio, projects, community, coaching, media pitching PRO Tier Additional Costs: O-1 filing (arrange separately), attorney fees, USCIS fees Elite Tier Includes: Everything in Pro PLUS complete O-1 filing, legal fees, agent-petitioner service, USCIS fees Elite Tier Additional Costs: None – everything included to approval ELITE TIER PRICING: Option 1: Monthly $2,000/month 6-8 month program duration Includes complete O-1 filing All legal fees covered Best for: Budget flexibility ELITE Tier - $2,000/month Option 2: Regular Processing Track $10,000 total (6 months) Approximately $1,667/month O-1 filed at month 6 4-6 months USCIS processing Best for: Planned timeline ELITE Regular - $10,000 total Option 3: Premium Processing Track $15,000 total (8 months) Approximately $1,875/month O-1 filed at month 8 15-day USCIS processing Best for: Time-sensitive situations ELITE Premium - $15,000 total What’s Included vs. Additional: PRO Tier Includes: Publications, portfolio, projects, community, coaching, media pitching PRO Tier Additional Costs: O-1 filing (arrange separately), attorney fees, USCIS fees Elite Tier Includes: Everything in Pro PLUS complete O-1 filing, legal fees, agent-petitioner service, USCIS fees Elite Tier Additional Costs: None – everything included to approval What We Expect From You Time Commitment: Weekly Requirements: 10-12 hours on project work 2-3 hours for workshops and community 1 hour for coaching calls and planning Total: 13-16 hours per week Can You Do This While Working Full-Time? Yes. Most participants maintain full-time employment or F-1 studies while in the program. Active Participation: You Must: Attend coaching calls regularly Complete project assignments on time Review and approve articles promptly Respond to media interview requests Participate in community actively Follow the evidence building roadmap We Cannot Help If: You're not responsive to communication You skip project work consistently You don't review articles for approval You avoid media opportunities You're not invested in your success Realistic Expectations: This Program Cannot: Guarantee O-1 approval (no one can legally guarantee USCIS approval) Build evidence overnight (takes 6-8 months minimum) Do the work for you (you must participate actively) Replace your professional development (this enhances it) This Program DOES: Provide systematic evidence building framework Give you real opportunities for recognition Connect you with high-value projects Position you for O-1 qualification Support you throughout the journey From Application to Enrollment in One Week Step 1: Free Assessment Take the 2-minute evaluation: Submit your background and current evidence. Get instant score showing how many of 8 O-1 criteria you currently meet. Result: Know exactly where you stand Step 2: Strategy Call (If Qualified) 15-30 minute phone consultation: Review your assessment results Discuss which tier fits your situation Map out your evidence building timeline Answer all your questions Determine program fit Result: Clear understanding of your path forward Step 3: Enrollment If we’re a mutual fit: Choose your tier and payment option Sign enrollment agreement Submit payment Receive welcome packet Result: Official program member Step 4: Onboarding (Week 1) Your first week: Meet your success manager (Elite tier) Complete detailed intake questionnaire Schedule your first coaching call Join the private community Receive first project assignment Submit topics for first articles Result: Ready to start building evidence Frequently Asked Questions How is this different from the Ready Filing program? Ready Filing is for people who already have 3-4 of the 8 O-1 criteria documented. Profile Building is for people who need to CREATE that evidence over 6-8 months. If you’re not sure which you need, take our assessment. Can I do this while on F-1 or OPT? Yes. The program is designed to work within F-1 and OPT restrictions. Project work is structured as educational/training rather than unauthorized employment. We have successfully worked with hundreds of F-1/OPT participants. What if I'm on H-1B? Perfect timing. Build your O-1 evidence while you have valid status, then transition to O-1 for more flexibility. You can participate in the program while maintaining H-1B employment. Do I need to quit my job? No. The program requires 13-16 hours per week, which most people fit around full-time work. Evening and weekend flexibility is available. What happens if I need to pause the program? You can pause for up to 60 days once during your enrollment for emergencies or major life events. Notify us 2 weeks in advance. Your timeline extends by the pause duration. Can I switch from Pro to Elite tier? Yes. You can upgrade from Pro to Elite at any time. The cost difference is credited toward your Elite tier fees. What if I don't qualify for O-1 after the program? If you complete the full Elite program and we file but you’re denied, we’ll work with you on repackaging and refiling at discounted rates. Our vetting process ensures we only file strong cases, but if something unexpected happens, we don’t abandon you. Are the articles really ghostwritten? Yes. Professional writers research and draft articles based on your input and expertise. You review, provide feedback, and approve before publication. They’re published under your name with you as the author. What industries do you work with? Primarily technology, AI/ML, software engineering, data science, and tech-adjacent fields. We also work with business professionals, researchers, and some creative technologists. Can international people outside the US join? Yes. The program is 100% remote. We work with people in India, China, Taiwan, Eastern Europe, Latin America, and everywhere else. Do you guarantee O-1 approval? No service can legally guarantee USCIS approval – that decision is solely USCIS’s. We can guarantee we’ll file your petition if you complete the Elite program, and we have a 94% approval rate, but the final decision is always USCIS’s. What happens to my articles and portfolio if I leave the program? Everything created during your time in the program remains yours permanently. Articles stay published under your name. With companies spending $35K+ annually on contract review, this platform offers 80% time savings and reduces legal costs by $200K/year for mid-size companies. This platform processes social media engagement, demographic data, and historical campaign performance to predict partnership success with 85% accuracy. The influencer marketing industry worth $21 billion lacks intelligent matching – brands guess at partnerships while celebrities field random offers. Early testing shows 3x improvement in campaign ROI when AI-selected partnerships are used. Investment opportunity: $75K to complete development, targeting the 10,000+ brands spending $500K+ annually on influencer partnerships. This comprehensive platform automates MLS listings analysis, generates property descriptions, schedules showings, produces market reports, and manages document workflows. Real estate agents waste 60% of their time on administrative tasks instead of selling. Our solution gives them back 30 hours per week while increasing transaction volume by 40%. Market opportunity: 2 million US agents spending $300/month on multiple tools. Investment: $125K to launch, projecting $10M ARR within 18 months. Learn More Child Reading Comprehension AI Personalized AI tutor that adapts to each child’s reading level, making literacy fun and measurable. Using gamification and voice recognition, the platform listens to children read aloud, provides real-time feedback, and adjusts difficulty automatically. Parents spend $5,000+ annually on tutoring while schools struggle with 1:30 teacher ratios. Our AI provides 1:1 attention at $19.99/month, with early pilots showing 2x improvement in reading scores after 90 days. EdTech market for K-5 reading is $4.2 billion and growing 15% annually. Kids can produce professional unboxing videos, toy reviews, and creative content without showing their faces – using AI avatars and voice modulation for privacy. With 75% of children wanting to be YouTubers and parents concerned about online safety, this fills a massive gap. The platform includes parental controls, automatic content moderation, and COPPA compliance built-in. Monetization through $14.99/month subscriptions plus revenue sharing on sponsored content. Investment: $90K to build, targeting 100K young creators within year one. Learn More SEC Perspective Analysis Tool AI system that predicts SEC enforcement actions and regulatory interpretations before they happen. By analyzing historical enforcement patterns, commissioner speeches, rule proposals, and market conditions, this tool gives compliance teams 60-90 day advance warning of regulatory shifts. Financial firms pay $250K+ annually for regulatory intelligence that’s often outdated. Our platform provides real-time analysis at $5,000/month, with pattern recognition showing 73% accuracy in predicting enforcement focus areas. Target market: 4,000+ RIAs, hedge funds, and public companies. Investment: $150K to complete the ML models and data pipeline. This platform processes thousands of government contracts daily, identifies perfect-fit opportunities, and auto-generates compliant proposals using historical winning patterns. Small businesses miss 90% of relevant opportunities and win only 3% of bids they submit. Our AI increases win rates to 15% while reducing proposal time by 75%. Secure your spot early.” Build Your Custom GPT What Can You Build? Sales & Proposals Generate proposals, qualify leads, draft emails, research prospects Data Analysis Pull reports, analyze trends, create visualizations, summarize metrics Content Creation Write blogs, social posts, emails, scripts—all in your brand voice Training & Onboarding Answer employee questions, provide procedures, guide workflows Research Assistant Gather competitive intel, summarize reports, find insights Customer Support Answer FAQs, troubleshoot issues, provide product guidance Documentation Generate SOPs, update wikis, create templates Process Automation Connect tools, trigger workflows, update systems FAQ Common Questions About Custom GPTs What's the difference between ChatGPT and a custom GPT? Standard ChatGPT is a general-purpose chatbot. A custom GPT is trained on YOUR specific knowledge, follows YOUR processes, and can connect to YOUR tools via custom actions. It’s like having an employee who knows your business inside and out. Do I need a ChatGPT Plus subscription? Yes, to create and use custom GPTs, you need ChatGPT Plus ($20/month per user) or ChatGPT Team/Enterprise. I’ll help you understand which plan fits your needs during our session. Can I share my custom GPT with my team? Absolutely! With ChatGPT Team or Enterprise, you can share GPTs across your organization. With Plus, you can share via link. I’ll show you the best approach for your situation. How much knowledge can I upload? You can upload multiple files up to 2GB total per GPT. For most businesses, that’s plenty for docs, templates, procedures, and guidelines. I’ll help you optimize what to include. What if I want to update my GPT later? You can make simple updates yourself using my documentation. For significant changes or new features, book another block. Many clients do periodic updates every few months. Can you integrate with any tool or API? If it has an API, I can connect it. Common integrations: CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce), project tools (Asana, ClickUp), Google Sheets, databases, and more. If you’re unsure, ask during booking. What if I prefer to work independently during the build? No problem! Just select ‘Independent Work’ when you book. You’ll provide detailed requirements upfront, I’ll build during the 3 hours, and we’ll review the finished GPT together. Is a Custom GPT Right for You? Perfect If You... Main Content: SaaS Prototype Development | Rapid MVP Builder | Innovative Automations Skip to content Contact Us Personal AI Productivity Services Turn Your SaaS Idea Into a Working Prototype in 3 Hours Stop overthinking. Stop waiting. Get a functional prototype or MVP that proves your concept works—built by an experienced developer who understands both code and business. Build it together or hand it off—you decide. 3 Hours Rapid Prototype Development $500 Per Block + Follow-up Included 1-on-1 Senior Developer Build Your Prototype See Examples 1 block daily Functional demo guaranteed Full code ownership The Startup Trap Most Founders Fall Into You have a great idea, but Analysis Paralysis You've been planning, wireframing, and researching for months. Meanwhile, your competitors are shipping. You need a prototype to test, not perfection. Development Black Hole Hiring a dev shop means $20K+ and 3-6 months. You don't need that yet. You need something quick and functional to validate your concept. Can't Pitch Without It Investors, customers, and partners need to SEE it, not just hear about it. Slides and mockups aren't enough. A working demo closes deals. The Solution A Real, Working Prototype in One Day Forget months-long dev projects. In 3 intensive hours, I’ll build a functional prototype that demonstrates your core concept. It won’t be production-ready, but it WILL work—and that’s what matters for validation, pitches, and early testing. Core Features Only We focus on the 20% of features that demonstrate 80% of the value. No bloat, no nice-to-haves. Just the functionality that proves your concept works. Modern Tech Stack Built with production-ready tools (React, Next.js, Python, APIs, databases). Easy to hand off to developers later for full build-out. Looks Professional Clean, modern UI using Tailwind CSS and component libraries. Not pixel-perfect, but good enough to impress investors and early users. Yours to Keep & Build On Full source code, deployment instructions, and documentation. Take it to any developer to continue building. No vendor lock-in. How Do You Want to Build? Different founders have different needs. Choose your approach. Build Together Live Stay on screen for 3 hours. You provide input, I build in real-time. Perfect for founders who want to stay hands-on and learn the technical side. Technical founders, hands-on builders, learning-focused entrepreneurs Brief Me, I Build Give me detailed specs, wireframes, and requirements. I’ll build independently and show you the working prototype at the end. Perfect for busy founders. Non-technical founders, clear specifications, busy schedules Best of Both Kick-off call (30 min), I build while you handle other work, review session (30 min) to test and refine. Most efficient option. Most projects, balanced approach, time-conscious founders Not sure? We'll decide together during the booking process. What's Included in Your Prototype Session Pre-Session Planning Brief questionnaire to understand your idea, requirements, and goals 3-Hour Intensive Build Session Focused development with your input (or independent work) Functional Prototype Working demo that demonstrates your core concept Clean, Modern UI Professional-looking interface using modern design frameworks Full Source Code & Documentation Everything you need to hand off to developers for full build Follow-Up Session 30-60 min session to address bugs, questions, or minor tweaks Prototypes We've Built in 3 Hours Real examples, real results AI Content Scheduler Social media scheduling tool powered by AI that suggests optimal posting times and generates captions. Working prototype included calendar view, AI suggestions, and post preview. Secured $50K seed funding | Timeline: 1 session View GPT Demo Team Task Manager Lightweight project management tool with kanban boards, task assignments, and team chat. Prototype proved concept to 5 beta customers who signed LOIs. 5 beta signups | Timeline: 1 session View GPT Demo Business Analytics Dashboard Real-time analytics platform that connects to multiple data sources and displays custom KPIs. Prototype included API integrations and interactive charts. $100K LOI from enterprise client | Timeline: 2 sessions View GPT Demo What's Realistic in 3 Hours? Here’s what I can typically build in a single 3-hour session: Definitely Achievable User authentication (sign up, login, logout) Basic dashboard with 3-5 key widgets Simple CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) Form submissions and data storage API integrations (fetch data from external services) Search and filter functionality Responsive design (mobile-friendly) Basic charts and data visualizations May Need 2 Sessions Complex multi-step workflows Real-time features (live updates, websockets) Payment integration (Stripe/PayPal) Advanced data transformations Multiple user roles and permissions File upload and processing Email notifications and workflows AI/ML integrations During booking, we'll discuss your requirements and determine if it fits in one session or needs two. Built With Modern, Production-Ready Tools Your prototype is built with the same tech stack used by successful startups and can scale to production. Frontend React or Next.js Tailwind CSS TypeScript (optional) shadcn/ui components Backend Node.js / Python Supabase or Firebase RESTful APIs Authentication libraries Database PostgreSQL Supabase (serverless) Firebase Realtime DB Deployment Vercel or Netlify Free hosting included Custom domain optional Integrations Stripe (payments) Sendgrid (email) OpenAI (AI features) Any API you need From Idea to Prototype in One Day Step 1 Book & Plan Reserve your 3-hour block (morning or afternoon EST). Complete the questionnaire with your idea, requirements, wireframes, and any reference examples. Payment ($500) due at booking. Step 2 Build Session We work together live or I build independently (your choice). Either way, you get a functional prototype in 3 focused hours. Step 3 Deploy & Handoff Your prototype is deployed to a live URL you can share. You get full source code, documentation, and a walkthrough of how everything works. Step 4 Refine & Iterate Use your included follow-up session (within 2 weeks) to fix bugs, add small features, or get advice on next steps. Solution Center One Simple Price $500 per 3-hour session 3 hours of intensive prototype development Functional working demo Professional UI design Full source code ownership Deployment to live URL Documentation and handoff 30-60 minute follow-up session No ongoing fees or contracts Only 1 block per day (10am-1pm EST OR 2-5pm EST). Book now to start building. Build Your Prototype What Kinds of SaaS Can You Build? B2B Tools CRM, project management, team collaboration, sales tools Analytics Platforms Business intelligence, dashboards, reporting, data viz Content Tools AI writing, social media management, content calendars E-commerce Storefronts, inventory management, order processing Ed-Tech Learning platforms, course management, student portals Community Platforms Forums, social networks, membership sites Healthcare Patient portals, appointment booking, health tracking AI-Powered Tools Chatbots, automation, AI integrations, ML demos FAQ Common Questions About SaaS Prototypes What's the difference between a prototype and MVP? A prototype proves your concept works—it demonstrates core functionality but may have rough edges. An MVP is a more polished version ready for real users. Most founders start with a prototype (what I build), validate, then invest in a full MVP. Will this be production-ready? Not quite. It’s functional and looks good, but it’s built for speed, not scale. Think of it as a proof-of-concept that proves your idea works. You’ll need additional development to make it production-ready (security hardening, optimization, testing). Can I use this with real customers? For demos and early beta testing, yes. For production use with paying customers, you’ll need additional work. I’ll flag what needs to be addressed before going live. What if my idea is complex and needs more than 3 hours? We can book multiple sessions. The first session builds the core, subsequent sessions add features. Most prototypes are complete in 1-2 sessions. Can you build this in my preferred technology? I typically use React/Next.js + Supabase/Firebase for speed, but if you have specific requirements (Python backend, specific framework), let me know during booking and we’ll discuss feasibility. What if I don't have wireframes or designs? No problem. We’ll sketch out the key screens together during the session. I have templates and components I can leverage to move quickly. Can you help me after the prototype is done? Yes! You can book additional sessions for new features, refinements, or consultation on next steps. Many clients use the follow-up session to plan their full development roadmap. Is This Right For Your Project? Perfect If You... Have a SaaS idea you want to validate quickly Need a demo to show investors, customers, or partners Want to test your concept before investing in full development Have mockups/wireframes but need something functional Are a non-technical founder who needs technical help Want to move fast without hiring a full dev team Not Ideal If You... Need a fully production-ready product immediately Have no idea what you want to build yet Expect enterprise-grade security and scalability from day one Need ongoing development and maintenance Want a mobile app (we focus on web apps) Have unlimited budget for full dev team What Happens After Your Prototype? Validate & Iterate Use your prototype to get feedback from potential users. Book additional sessions to refine based on what you learn. Raise Funding Show your working prototype to investors. Many founders secure seed funding with a functional demo. I can provide technical guidance for investor meetings. Build to Production Hand off the code to a development team for full build-out. I’ll provide a technical handoff document outlining what’s built and what’s needed next. Ready to Build Your SaaS Prototype? Stop planning. Start building. In just 3 hours, you’ll have a working prototype that validates your idea. Book Your Build Session Now Questions about your idea?
